sentences.en: A little paint will soon transform this old car.
sentences.cn: 只要喷上一点油漆就会马上使这部旧车变个模样.

sentences.en: A paint finish can transform something everyday and mundane into something more elaborate.
sentences.cn: 油漆罩面能够使普通而平凡的东西看上去更加精致。

sentences.en: Add the transforms and shapes to the transform graph.
sentences.cn: 新增的变换和形状的变换图形.

sentences.en: An image fusion method based on cortex transform is proposed.
sentences.cn: 摘要提出一种基于皮层变换的图像融合方法.

sentences.en: And it's bringing about the opportunity to transform vision, curiosity, and wonder into practical knowledge.
sentences.cn: 它正在创造机会使幻想 、 求知欲和高深莫测的事情转化成实实在在的知识.

sentences.en: Certain granular solids transform into highly mobile slurries.
sentences.cn: 一定数量的粒状固体就可以变成非常易流动的泥浆.

sentences.en: DCT is based on FFT ( Fast Fourier Transform ), so integers FFT transform must be structured firstly.
sentences.cn: DCT变换采取基于FFT ( fastFourier transform ) 的快速算法, 所以,首先寻找整数FFT变换.

sentences.en: Deliver your awesome power and transform my potion.
sentences.cn: 用你们神圣的力量幻化我的药剂吧.

sentences.en: He managed to transform the bucolic of butterflies into a dangerous sport.
sentences.cn: 他居然把捉蝴蝶的田园消遣变成了一种危险的游戏.

sentences.en: Heat can transform water into steam.
I believe she would transform me into a talker.
sentences.cn: 我相信,她会把我这个沉默寡言的人变成个碎嘴子.

sentences.en: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.cn: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

sentences.en: The photochemical reactions transform the light into electrical impulses.
sentences.cn: 光化学反应使光变为电脉冲。

sentences.en: The sofa can transform for use as a bed.
To transform hills into fields is an extremely tough job.
sentences.cn: 改山造田可是硬碰硬的事.

sentences.en: Water can transform a desert into a garden.
sentences.cn: 水能把一片不毛之地变成一座花园.

sentences.en: Your metabolic rate is the speed at which your body transforms food into energy.
sentences.cn: 你的新陈代谢率就是你身体将食物转换成能量的速度。

words.tran_cn: 可变化的；可变形的；可转化的
[电] 变压器；促使变化的人

phrases.tran_cn: 傅里叶变换红外光谱学
希伯特转换；希耳伯特变换；希尔波特滤波器

trans.tran_en: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

trans.tran_cn: 使改观， 改革； 变换
trans.tran_en: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it
